title: spack does not propagate (default) target to dependent packages - when perl is listed in packages.yaml

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

Spack determines:

==> Warning: gcc@7.4.0 cannot build optimized binaries for "cascadelake". Using best target possible: "skylake_avx512"

But then - it goes ahead and tries to build some dependent packages with `arch=linux-centos7-cascadelake`

Presence of `perl` in `packages.yaml` appears to trigger this behavior [for this case with openmpi]

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ cat ~/.spack/packages.yaml
packages:
  perl:
    externals:
    - spec: perl@5.16.3
      prefix: /usr
    buildable: False


$ spack spec openmpi%gcc@7.4.0
Input spec
--------------------------------
openmpi%gcc@7.4.0

Concretized
--------------------------------
==> Warning: gcc@7.4.0 cannot build optimized binaries for "cascadelake". Using best target possible: "skylake_avx512"
openmpi@4.1.1%gcc@7.4.0~atomics~cuda~cxx~cxx_exceptions+gpfs~internal-hwloc~java~legacylaunchers~lustre~memchecker~pmi~singularity~sqlite3+static~thread_multiple+vt+wrapper-rpath fabrics=none schedulers=none arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
    ^hwloc@2.5.0%gcc@7.4.0~cairo~cuda~gl~libudev+libxml2~netloc~nvml+pci+shared arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
        ^libpciaccess@0.16%gcc@7.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
            ^libtool@2.4.6%gcc@7.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
                ^m4@1.4.19%gcc@7.4.0+sigsegv arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
                    ^libsigsegv@2.13%gcc@7.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
            ^pkgconf@1.7.4%gcc@7.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-cascadelake
            ^util-macros@1.19.1%gcc@7.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
        ^libxml2@2.9.10%gcc@7.4.0~python arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
            ^libiconv@1.16%gcc@7.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
            ^xz@5.2.5%gcc@7.4.0~pic libs=shared,static arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
            ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@7.4.0+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
        ^ncurses@6.2%gcc@7.4.0~symlinks+termlib abi=none arch=linux-centos7-cascadelake
    ^libevent@2.1.12%gcc@7.4.0+openssl arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
        ^openssl@1.1.1k%gcc@7.4.0~docs+systemcerts arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
            ^perl@5.16.3%gcc@7.4.0+cpanm+shared+threads patches=0eac10ed90aeb0459ad8851f88081d439a4e41978e586ec743069e8b059370ac arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
    ^numactl@2.0.14%gcc@7.4.0 patches=4e1d78cbbb85de625bad28705e748856033eaafab92a66dffd383a3d7e00cc94,62fc8a8bf7665a60e8f4c93ebbd535647cebf74198f7afafec4c085a8825c006 arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
        ^autoconf@2.69%gcc@7.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
        ^automake@1.16.3%gcc@7.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
    ^openssh@8.5p1%gcc@7.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-cascadelake
        ^libedit@3.1-20210216%gcc@7.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-cascadelake

$ spack install --fail-fast openmpi%gcc@7.4.0
```

### Error Message

```
==> Installing pkgconf-1.7.4-onti3kpmfuuaau6pkg53zfoaerpli674
==> No binary for pkgconf-1.7.4-onti3kpmfuuaau6pkg53zfoaerpli674 found: installing from source
==> Error: UnsupportedMicroarchitecture: cannot produce optimized binary for micro-architecture 'cascadelake' with gcc@7.4.0 [supported compiler versions are 9.0:]

/data/balay/spack.x/lib/spack/spack/build_environment.py:1021, in _setup_pkg_and_run:
       1018        tb_string = traceback.format_exc()
       1019
       1020        # build up some context from the offending package so we can
  >>   1021        # show that, too.
       1022        package_context = get_package_context(tb)
       1023
       1024        logfile = None
```
Workaround for now:
```console
$ spack spec openmpi%gcc@7.4.0 target=skylake_avx512
```

<!-- If Spack reported an error, provide the error message. If it did not report an error but the output appears incorrect, provide the incorrect output. If there was no error message and no output but the result is incorrect, describe how it does not match what you expect. -->
```console
$ spack --debug --stacktrace install --fail-fast openmpi%gcc@7.4.0 
```
[debug-stack.log.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/6779688/debug-stack.log.txt)

### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->
```
$ spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.2-3412-e0b901153b
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-centos7-cascadelake
* **Concretizer:** original
```

<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

### Additional information
